body_text.text: A Büchi or Muller automaton is said to be deterministic if the associated FSM is deterministic.

By R. Mc Naughton’s Theorem, see [15], the expressive power of deterministic MA (DMA) is equal to the expressive power of non deterministic MA which is also equal to the expressive power of non deterministic BA.
Define now the next classes of the Borel hierarchy:

The hierarchy defined above is the hierarchy of Borel sets of finite rank. The Borel Hierarchy is also defined for transfinite levels (see [11]) but we shall not need this in the sequel. Recall that the class of Borel subsets of a Cantor space is the closure of the class of open sets under countable unions and countable intersections.
Then we can state the following proposition.
An important result of descriptive set theory is the following result, see [11, page 47].
Every Borel set of a Cantor space has the Baire property.
We are going to prove an automatic version of the above theorem. We first give the following definition.
In order to prove this result, we first prove the following lemmas.
The above Corollary followed already from Staiger’s paper [19], see also [14]. So we get here another proof of this result, based on the automatic Baire property.
Recall now the following undecidability result of Frougny and Sakarovitch.
([7]). One cannot decide whether a given infinitary rational relation is synchronous.
Prieur proved the following decidability result.
On the other hand the following undecidability result was proved in [3].
The situation is quite different in the case of synchronous functions. The following results were proved in [3].
We now state an automatic version of this theorem.
